result.execSummary:
The defendant Pravion J Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: No obj to early term of prob after 3 yrs if def has completed all cond of prob w/ no violations, ATR's or new charges to level of probable cause.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency within 1st 2 yrs of probation.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Reed Cornia.  Michael P Finley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 10:30 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.  
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by the end of the business day today, Thursday, May 1, 2014. If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 15

Defendant in court with Attorney Reed Cornia.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 10:30 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.  
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.    If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
